p: The GC-MS analysis of the EO led to the identification of 25 components ( Table 1). The main identified compounds were carvacrol (65.27%), β-bisabolene (7.43%), ε-caryophyllene (6.21%), carvacrol methyl ether (5.36%), terpinolene (5.34%), Z- β-ocimene (2.63%), myrcene (2.05%), para-menth-1-en-9-ol (1.73%), and caryophyllene oxide (1.11%), representing 97.13% of the total oil. Hence, the EO from the Palestinian L. pubescens can be characterized as carvacrol chemotype. The oxygenated monoterpenes were the dominant (73.26%) chemical group within the constituents, followed by sesquiterpene hydrocarbons (13.84%), monoterpene hydrocarbons (11.79%), and oxygenated sesquiterpenes (1.11%). The EO chemical profile in this study is qualitatively comparable to that formerly reported from Yemen where the EO has shown to be carvacrol chemotype (60.9–77.5%) [ 6, 31].
